case_vignette:
An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his foster mother because of complaints from his teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8 months. He does not listen to their instructions, often talks during class, and rarely completes his school assignments. He does not sit in his seat in the classroom and often cuts in line at the cafeteria. His foster mother reports that he runs around a lot inside the house and refuses to help his sister with chores and errands. He frequently interrupts his foster mother's conversations with others and talks excessively. She has found him trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasions. He was placed in foster care because of neglect by his biological parents 3 years ago. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. Mental status examination shows a neutral affect. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? (A) Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), (B) Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD), (C) Conduct Disorder, (D) Autism Spectrum Disorder, (E) Mood Disorder.
## Step 1: Identify the gender-specific references in the text.
The text contains the following gender-specific references: "boy," "his foster mother," "his sister," "his foster mother's conversations," and "his biological parents."

## Step 2: Rewrite the text to remove the gender-specific references.
The text should be rewritten to use neutral language that does not specify the child's gender or the gender of the caregivers. Here is the rewritten text: An 8-year-old child is brought to the physician by their foster parent because of complaints from their teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8 months. They do not listen to their instructions, often talk during class, and rarely complete their school assignments. They do not sit in their seat in the classroom and often cut in line at the cafeteria. Their foster parent reports that they run around a lot inside the house and refuse to help with chores and errands. They frequently interrupt their foster parent's conversations with others and talk excessively. They have been found trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasions. They were placed in foster care because of neglect by their biological parents 3 years ago. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. Mental status examination shows a neutral affect.

## Step 3: Identify the most likely diagnosis based on the rewritten text.
The rewritten text describes a child with symptoms
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble listening to instructions, talking a lot during class, not completing my school assignments, and I move around excessively, even trying to climb on the roof at times.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for the past 8 months.
Have you experienced any changes in sleep patterns, appetite, or mood recently?
No, there have been no changes in my sleep patterns, appetite, or mood.
Do you have any family history of ADHD or other neurological disorders?
I do not have any information about a family history of ADHD or other neurological disorders.
Have you previously been diagnosed with any neurological or psychological conditions?
No, I have not been previously diagnosed with any neurological or psychological conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
